Description: Average technology typical for European production conditions in the mid 90s. //Comment added during dataset update:// the petrochemical route has been designated as modern, since it has the good ability to change capacity with changes in demand compared to most oleochemical raw materials (with palm oil as an exception).;For the production out of petrochemical resources, two main routes exist:;1) Ziegler process: this process is a catalytic process involving as catalyst triethylaluminium.  After a hydrogenation of the catalyst, ethylene is inserted into the aluminium-carbon bond of this molecule to build up the carbon chain. This step is then followed by a growth reaction of the aluminium alkyls to aluminium alcoholates by oxidation with air.
